item.title: Why RSS and not a Newsletter?
item.description:
Why RSS and not a Newsletter?

I find the concept of newsletters quite revolting. First, collecting emails is a violation of your anonymity. Then, the letters themselves are rarely anything more than poorly disguised adverts. Newsletters are marketing tools. Used to circumvent adblockers, competition, and to reach you directly through your inbox.

Newsletters are antithetical to my values and beliefs.

While RSS is more awkward, it puts the control into your hands. I can’t know who subscribes, when or if the posts are opened, and I don’t have your email to sell to third parties. It’s a more peaceful format of information delivery.

What will appear in this feed?

News about substantial updates to the website. When a new literary piece is published. When a piece of information has a time factor. I won’t bother you with every warble I post.

And I will not coerce you into buying some shitty course or pdf.


That’s all for now.
